trans-unit.target: Attach a disk to a virtual machine | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to attach a data disk to an Azure virtual machine and initialize it so it's ready for use.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to attach a data disk to an Azure virtual machine and initialize it so it's ready for use.

trans-unit.source: How to attach a data disk to a Windows virtual machine
trans-unit.target: How to attach a data disk to a Windows virtual machine

trans-unit.source: You can attach empty disks and disks with data.
trans-unit.target: You can attach empty disks and disks with data.

trans-unit.source: In both cases, the disks are actually .vhd files that reside in an Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: In both cases, the disks are actually .vhd files that reside in an Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: Also in both cases, after you attach the disk, you'll need to initialize it so it's ready for use.
trans-unit.target: Also in both cases, after you attach the disk, you'll need to initialize it so it's ready for use.

trans-unit.source: It's a best practice to use one or more separate disks to store a virtual machine's data.
trans-unit.target: It's a best practice to use one or more separate disks to store a virtual machine's data.

trans-unit.source: When you create an Azure virtual machine, it has a disk for the operating system mapped to drive C and a temporary disk mapped to drive D. Do not use drive D to store data. As the name implies, drive D provides temporary storage only.
trans-unit.target: When you create an Azure virtual machine, it has a disk for the operating system mapped to drive C and a temporary disk mapped to drive D. Do not use drive D to store data. As the name implies, drive D provides temporary storage only.

trans-unit.source: It offers no redundancy or backup because it doesn't reside in Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: It offers no redundancy or backup because it doesn't reside in Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Connect to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see <link><linkText>How to log on to a virtual machine running Windows Server[logon]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see <link><linkText>How to log on to a virtual machine running Windows Server[logon]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: After you log on to the virtual machine, open Server Manager.
trans-unit.target: After you log on to the virtual machine, open Server Manager.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, select File and Storage Services.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, select File and Storage Services.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Open Server Manager</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Open Server Manager</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Expand the menu and select Disks.
trans-unit.target: Expand the menu and select Disks.

trans-unit.source: The Disks section lists disk 0, disk 1, and disk 2.
trans-unit.target: The Disks section lists disk 0, disk 1, and disk 2.

trans-unit.source: Disk 0 is the operating system disk, disk 1 is the temporary disk (which should not be used for data storage), and disk 2 is the data disk you attached to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Disk 0 is the operating system disk, disk 1 is the temporary disk (which should not be used for data storage), and disk 2 is the data disk you attached to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The data disk has a capacity of 5 GB, based on what you specified when you attached the disk.
trans-unit.target: The data disk has a capacity of 5 GB, based on what you specified when you attached the disk.

trans-unit.source: Right-click disk 2 and select Initialize.
trans-unit.target: Right-click disk 2 and select Initialize.

trans-unit.source: You're notified that all data will be erased when the disk is initialized.
trans-unit.target: You're notified that all data will be erased when the disk is initialized.

trans-unit.source: Click Yes to acknowledge the warning and initialize the disk.
trans-unit.target: Click Yes to acknowledge the warning and initialize the disk.

trans-unit.source: Then, right-click disk 2 again and select New Volume.
trans-unit.target: Then, right-click disk 2 again and select New Volume.

trans-unit.source: Complete the wizard using the default values.
trans-unit.target: Complete the wizard using the default values.

trans-unit.source: When the wizard is done, the Volumes section lists the new volume.
trans-unit.target: When the wizard is done, the Volumes section lists the new volume.

trans-unit.source: The disk is now online and ready to store data.
trans-unit.target: The disk is now online and ready to store data.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Volume successfully initialized</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Volume successfully initialized</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The size of the virtual machine determines how many disks you can attach to it.
trans-unit.target: The size of the virtual machine determines how many disks you can attach to it.
